intro: Geniostoma australianum, commonly known as the Australian starfish flower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is adapted to thrive in dry conditions, making it a resilient species in arid environments. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important component of its native habitat.
